metadata.title: CVE-2017-5059 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 58.0.3029.81 for Linux,Windows, and Mac, and 58.0.3029.83 for Android, allowed a remote attackerto potentially obtain code execution via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5059` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
